title: Failed to build Spack documentation locally
body:
I tried to build the Spack documentation according to these instructions:

https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contribution_guide.html?highlight=sphinx#documentation-tests

but it fails with
```
Extension error:
Could not import extension sphinxcontrib.programoutput (exception: No module named sphinxcontrib.programoutput)
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack activate py-sphinx
==> Package py-sphinx/rwsbsbs is already activated.
$ spack activate py-sphinx-rtd-theme
==> Package py-sphinx-rtd-theme/mun75y3 is already activated.
$ spack activate py-sphinxcontrib-programoutput
==> Package py-sphinxcontrib-programoutput/bu7kkwi is already activated.
$ cd "$SPACK_ROOT/lib/spack/docs"
$ make clean
rm -f command_index.rst
rm -rf _build/* spack*.rst llnl*.rst
$ make
sphinx-build -b html -d _build/doctrees  -E . _build/html
Running Sphinx v1.4.9
making output directory...
Creating file ./spack.rst.
Creating file ./spack.build_systems.rst.
Creating file ./spack.cmd.rst.
Creating file ./spack.cmd.common.rst.
Creating file ./spack.cmd.modules.rst.
Creating file ./spack.compilers.rst.
Creating file ./spack.hooks.rst.
Creating file ./spack.modules.rst.
Creating file ./spack.operating_systems.rst.
Creating file ./spack.platforms.rst.
Creating file ./spack.reporters.rst.
Creating file ./spack.schema.rst.
Creating file ./spack.test.rst.
Creating file ./spack.util.rst.
Creating file ./spack.util.imp.rst.
Creating file ./llnl.rst.
Creating file ./llnl.util.rst.
Creating file ./llnl.util.tty.rst.

Extension error:
Could not import extension sphinxcontrib.programoutput (exception: No module named sphinxcontrib.programoutput)
Makefile:90: recipe for target 'html' failed
make: *** [html] Error 1
```

### Information on your system
```
$ uname -a 
Linux 4.9.0-8-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.130-2 (2018-10-27) x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Debian GNU/Linux 9.6 (stretch)
```

```
$ which python
/usr/bin/python
```

```
$ python --version
Python 2.7.13
```

My `PYTHONPATH` is empty:
```
$ echo $PYTHONPATH

```
Should activating the above packages add their path here or am I missing something?
